body:
If a Spack `Executable` is run with `error`/`output` set as `str`, those outputs from the process are captured. If the process fails, Spack was not reporting them as part of the exception (so that information was lost).

Cases where `error`/`output` are set to be a file or were unspecified (in which case the parent process streams are used) were not an issue.
title: report error/output for failed processes when stderr is captured
